releases.details: Part of K9 Tales Box Set
special_features: Commentary by Louise Jameson, John Leeson, Bob Baker, Mat Irvine
Visual Effect discussion at Bray Studios
Easter Egg: K9 on Larry Grayson's Generation Game

notes: Re-introduction of the 'primary' TARDIS console room.
Inspiration from the film Fantastic Voyage.
Working titles included 'The Invisible Invader' and 'The Enemy Within'.
Tom Baker had difficulty acting opposite the Nucleus, referred to it humorously.

in_universe_mythology: The Nucleus of the Swarm as a sentient virus.

continuity_notes: The Swarm remains dormant in the TARDIS's computer.
Doctor's memory of using miniaturisation recurs in 'Into the Dalek'.

plot.plot_summary: Part 1: A spaceship crew is infected by a sentient virus from a space anomaly and overrun Titan Base. The Fourth Doctor and Leela respond to a distress call, but the Doctor becomes infected. They meet the infected crewmen and attempt to stop the spread of the virus. The Doctor and Leela become separated; Leela learns of hostile behaviors while the Doctor is commanded to harm Leela.

Part 2: The Doctor, in a coma, is taken to the Bi-Al Foundation for treatment while under attack from an expanding infected staff. Professor Marius and his robot dog, K9, become involved. Marius prepares to free the Doctor from the mind virus by injecting microscopic clones of the Doctor and Leela into the Doctor's body.

Part 3: Inside the Doctor's brain, the clones try to locate the Nucleus. Infected people attempt to capture the Doctor. The clones contact the Nucleus which plans to spread via the Doctor's TARDIS. As the clones fail at elimination efforts, the real Nucleus escapes into the real world.

Part 4: The Nucleus, now large, proclaims the age of the Virus. The Doctor hatches a plan without the dimensional stabiliser. He uses Leela's immunity to develop antibodies and free Professor Marius. The Doctor, Leela, and K9 disable the Nucleus's plan on Titan Base by planning to explode the base.
